Package assignment5

Class Rectangle

  • java.lang.Object
    • assignment5.Shape
      • assignment5.Rectangle
  • public class Rectangle
extends Shape
    Version:
    1.0.0 Public class for Rectangle Objects. Extends the abstract class Shape.
    Author:
    Nick Thompson

    • Constructor Detail

      • Rectangle

        public Rectangle​(int startX,
                 int startY,
                 int width,
                 int height)
        Class constructor that creates a Rectangle object. Accepts startX, startY, width, height as parameters. Assigns the Rectangle object a random color.
        Parameters:
        startX - The x-coordinate of the starting point of the Rectangle.
        startY - The y-coordinate of the starting point of the Rectangle.
        width - The width of the Rectangle.
        height - The height of the Rectangle.

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public void draw​(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Implements Shape's abstract draw method. Sets the color of the Graphics object to be the color of the Rectangle. Calls the drawRect(int, int, int, int) method of the Graphics object.
        Specified by:
        draw in class Shape
        Parameters:
        g - The Graphics object.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides the built-in toString() method to return the String in the desired format.
        Specified by:
        toString in class Shape

      • contains

        public boolean contains​(int x,
                        int y)
        Implements Shape's abstract contains method. Reformats the accepted int x and int y parameters to be in the form of an array int[]{x, y}. Uses the corners of the Rectangle object to determine if the test point is close to an edge of the Rectangle. Returns true if the test point is within 0.5 units of the edge. Returns false otherwise.
        Specified by:
        contains in class Shape
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the test point.
        y - The y-coordinate of the test point.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • distanceOf

        public double distanceOf​(int[] firstPoint,
                         int[] secondPoint)
        Uses the distance formula to return the distance between two points.
        Parameters:
        firstPoint - The first point that is passed in.
        secondPoint - The second point that is passed in.
        Returns:
        The calculated distance.
